featured.text: the passing shoppers to visit his shop and buy the freshly baked bread.
the sweet smell from the bakery, so I walked in and bought a fresh loaf of bread.
At approximately the same time, the Earl of Sandwich popularized a new way of eating bread—in thin slices, with something (e.g., jam or cucumbers) between them.

However, each time he lost a dove into the cold water, and—with the help of her competition, his coaches would lock him in a cage sister and two men—swam and pushed the boat for for days, feeding him only coffee and bread.

definition.zh_def: 一種由麵粉、水和其他成分製成的食品，通常經過烘烤。
definition.en_def: A food made from flour, water, and other ingredients, usually baked.
definition.example: She bought a loaf of bread from the bakery.
